Norway & Northern Lights | Cunard | World Travellers - World Travellers Find your nearest store Destinations Our Deals About Blogs Contact Us SIGN UP Norwegian Fjords 12 Nights | Southampton Roundtrip Receive a Reduced Deposit PLUS UP TO US$600 onboard credit per stateroom! Deal Details Travel Dates 13 Oct 2026 Sale Ends Dec 8, 2025 Priced From $3,745 per person Enquire Now Receive a Reduced Deposit PLUS UP TO US$600 onboard credit per stateroom! Description Step aboard Cunard’s newest ship and set sail on an unforgettable voyage to witness one of nature’s most mesmerising displays - the Aurora Borealis. These special itineraries are timed between October and March, the optimal season to see the Northern Lights illuminate the skies above Norway. Go in search of the ethereal Northern Lights with Queen Anne on this 12-night adventure to the far north. Sail through the majestic Norwegian fjords with late evening calls in Tromsø and Narvik - two of the best places in the world to view this celestial spectacle. By day, explore Norway’s dramatic fjords, charming coastal towns, and snow-dusted landscapes. By night, wrap up in a blanket with a warm drink in hand on deck as the sky dances in shades of green, pink, and violet. Whether you're chasing the Northern Lights or simply relaxing in style, Cunard’s Norway voyages promise magic, majesty, and memories to last a lifetime. Pricing Oceanview Stateroom (Cat EB) From $3,745* per person, twin share Receive US$560 Onboard credit per stateroom! Balcony Stateroom (Cat BF) From $4,499* per person, twin share (pictured) Receive US$600 Onboard credit per stateroom! What's Included 12-night voyage from Southampton return on Queen Anne All main meals and entertainment on board Daily traditional Afternoon Tea in the Queens Room On board activities including the Insights Programme, live music and theatre, group gym classes, deck games and more Gala Evenings All port charges Itinerary Details Day 1: Southampton, England Set in the scenic English county of Hampshire, Southampton is a lively waterfront city where rich maritime history meets modern attractions. Whether you explore its historic districts or contemporary areas, Southampton promises a charming experience for every visitor. Day 2-3: At Sea Day 4: Alesund, Norway Sailing through Norway’s glass-like waters on route to Alesund, you’ll be struck by a sweeping peninsula of Art Nouveau architecture, stretching to lush greenery, where mountain peaks reach skyward, reflected in the converging fjords. Arriving in Alesund, you could be forgiven for thinking you’d stepped off your ship into the pages of a fairy-tale. A myriad of towering spires and decorative turrets, it’s easy to see why this vibrant fishing port is regarded as one of the prettiest cities in Norway. Day 5: At Sea Day 6-7: Tromso, Norway Whilst sailing to Tromso, you’ll encounter Mother Nature at her most spectacular. Surrounded by unspoiled wilderness, glass-like fjords, and towering snow-capped mountains, every vista here offers something else to savour. The sky above Tromso can also be a truly breathtaking spectacle when the dramatic northern lights dance across the sky during dark winter nights. In summer, the midnight sun never sets on this bustling city, famous for its vibrant nightlife. The crisp, clear days give way to long, bright nights, filled with hiking, fishing, or simply a warming cup of tea as you watch the locals go about their day. Day 8-9: Narvik, Norway Rugged mountains meet rippling blue fjords on a cruise to Narvik, Norway. A favourite destination for keen skiers, the snowy peaks here glide gently downward towards stretches of white sandy beaches that surround the port itself. Lying 137 miles inside the Arctic Circle, Narvik may be one of the world’s most northerly towns, but the North Atlantic currents and the mountains that shelter the town make it surprisingly mild. A serene and welcoming region, Narvik is a magical gateway to rich culture, exquisite food, wildlife, and a dramatic Norwegian landscape. Day 10: At Sea Day 11: Stavanger, Norway Norway's Stavanger is not only blessed with compelling history, but also a natural beauty. From the ancient port, the city radiates across a network of islands which are connected by graceful bridges.Your guide to Stavanger. Once the European Capital of Culture, the Norwegian city of Stavanger is blessed with a compelling history and unbridled beauty effortlessly blending the old with the new. From its ancient port the city fans out along a network of islands, each one connected to its neighbour by an elegant bridge. In Gamle Stavanger (the historic centre) artists’ workshops still occupy 18th century houses, much as they did in years gone by. It’s a wonderful chance to step back in time and immerse in the Stavanger of old, while the city’s museums shed light on Stavanger’s long-standing relationship to the sea. Day 12: At Sea Day 13: Southampton, England Arrive in Southampton & disembark your ship. Your Ship Queen Anne’s stunning interiors blend historical inspiration with a bold new design direction for the future. Step aboard to experience a ship that seamlessly combines modernity with timeless elegance, offering both exciting new experiences and beloved Cunard classics. On a Queen Anne voyage, you’ll be inspired by a perfect fusion of classic and contemporary. Enjoy the freedom to choose as much or as little activity as you like, and savour all the elements that make Cunard ships exceptional. With luxurious touches and sophisticated décor, each day on Queen Anne promises unparalleled comfort. Unwind in the serene Mareel Spa, savour the tradition of our signature Afternoon Tea, and revel in the special ambiance of the Grand Lobby during Gala Evenings. Rest assured that every detail has been thoughtfully managed for your ultimate enjoyment. Terms & Conditions T&Cs: Pricing is correct as of 21 October 25.
